description: [CAF] Senegalese coach Aliou Cissé has vowed to end Libya's 12-year absence from major international tournaments, expressing confidence in his ability to lead the Mediterranean Knights back to the big stage.
title: Africa: Aliou Cissé Confident of Breaking Libya's 12-Year Qualification Drought

description: [CAF] Christopher Bonsu Baah has earned his maiden call-up to the Ghana national team as head coach Otto Addo named a 23-man squad for the crucial 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers against Chad and Madagascar.
title: Africa: Bonsu Baah Earns First Ghana Call-Up As Partey Returns for World Cup Qualifiers

description: [CAF] The Central African Republic announced a new-look squad of 25 for their FIFA World Cup qualifiers this month, as they take on Madagascar and Mali.
title: Africa: Central African Republic Announced a New-Look Squad for FIFA World Cup Qualifiers

description: [CAF] Togo head coach Nibombé Daré has announced a 25-man squad for the upcoming 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers against Mauritania and Senegal, with a mix of experienced players and fresh talents aiming to boost the Hawks' chances of qualification.
title: Africa: Kevin Denkey, Dermane Karim Headline Togo's World Cup Qualifier Squad

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- Rwandan President Paul Kagame has accused the international community of using aid as a tool of control over developing nations.
title: Africa: Kagame Accuses International Community of 'Weaponizing' Aid to Control Nations

description: [Capital FM] When Donald Trump introduced tariffs during his second presidency, many assumed they were primarily aimed at China, Canada, and Mexico. However, with his return to the White House, his trade policies are once again sending ripples across the global economy, and Africa--Kenya included--will not be spared. These tariffs are not just an economic maneuver; they are a seismic shift in global trade that could make life more expensive for Kenyans, disrupt key revenue sources, and force the country to rethink its
title: Africa: Trump's Tariffs Aren't Just About China - Africa and Kenya Will Feel the Impact Too

description: [IPS] Stockholm, Sweden -- In these turbulent and sad times, it is hard to keep quiet about abuses and violations of human rights taking place around the world; in eastern DR Congo, South Sudan, Ukraine, and Gaza. Among the most egregious examples of incomprehensible stances on such abuses is the behaviour displayed by the Trump Administration, not least the President's behaviour against the lawfully elected president of Ukraine. Trump's doubts about the validity of a nation's desperate struggle against the forces of a dictatorial
title: Africa: Trump, Democracy and the U.S. Constitution

description: [ISS] The African National Congress' friendship with Tehran is becoming the main bugbear in US relations with South Africa.
title: Africa: Iran and the Price of the ANC's Nostalgia

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- A celebration of figures credited for Somali excellence will take center stage in Nairobi on April 15 as the city plays host to the East Africa Somali Awards 2025.
title: Africa: Nairobi to Host East Africa Somali Awards 2025 in April

description: [SAnews.gov.za] President Cyril Ramaphosa has welcomed the European Union's €4.7 billion Global Gateway Investment Package aimed at supporting strategic investment projects.
title: Africa: South Africa-European Union Summit Concludes

description: [Leadership] Pan-African cryptocurrency exchange and financial technology firm, Yellow Card has restated its commitment to gender parity in Africa's tech industry.
title: Africa: Yellow Card Commits to Achieve Gender Parity in Africa's Tech Industry

description: [Egypt Online] Minister of Foreign Affairs Badr Abdelatty, received the European Union's Special Representative for the Horn of Africa, Annette Weber, to enhance coordination between Egypt and the EU on ways to support security and stability in the Horn of Africa region.
title: Africa: FM Discusses Security, Stability in Horn of Africa With EU Representative

description: [ANGOP] Addis Ababa -- The President of the Republic and of the African Union (AU), João Lourenço, defended on Thursday (March 13), in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, the need for the continent to hold a broad conference reserved solely for the analysis of conflicts in Africa.
title: Africa: João Lourenço Advocates Broad Conference to Assess Conflicts in Africa

description: [ANGOP] Addis Ababa -- The Chairperson of the African Union, João Lourenço, on Thursday in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, instructed the organization's Commission to pay special attention to infrastructure and to outline a strategy to mobilize international partners interested in making mutually beneficial investments.
title: Africa: AU Chairperson Calls for Special Attention to Infrastructure

description: [Thomson Reuters Foundation] The COVID-19 pandemic was supposed to decimate African populations, but that didn't happen. Why?
title: Africa: Covid-19 - How Did Africa Defy the Odds With Fewer Deaths?

description: [African Arguments] Debating Ideas reflects the values and editorial ethos of the African Arguments book series, publishing engaged, often radical, scholarship, original and activist writing from within the African continent and beyond. It offers debates and engagements, contexts and controversies, and reviews and responses flowing from the African Arguments books. It is edited and managed by the International African Institute, hosted at SOAS University of London, the owners of the book series of the same name.
title: Africa: Business, Borders and Bloodshed - Undoing the Berlin Conference's Economic and Political Legacies

description: [GroundUp] Lesotho Highlands aquaculture project offers little in return for its licence
title: Africa: The 'Biggest Trout Farm in Africa' and the Failed R5,000 Community Fund
